key_points: In 2009, Tiger Woods was involved in a car accident outside his Florida mansion, leading to a public scandal involving allegations of infidelity.
Woods' then-wife, Elin Nordegren, was said to have broken the car's windows to rescue him, amidst speculation of an argument.
The scandal resulted in Woods losing most of his sponsors and facing difficulties in his golf career.
Elin Nordegren filed for divorce in August 2010, receiving a reported $100 million settlement.
Woods has described the period following the scandal as painful and embarrassing.
Despite the setbacks, Woods managed to rebuild his life and career, winning the 2019 Masters Tournament.
Woods recently underwent a successful back surgery, a microdiscectomy procedure.
Friends and sources close to Woods highlight his transformation into a better person and father post-scandal.
Woods' relationship with his children, Charlie, 11, and Sam, 13, is described as very close, with effective co-parenting from both Woods and Nordegren.
The scandal and its aftermath are explored in HBO's new two-part documentary 'Tiger'.
